articles.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says club "in trouble" with a mounting injury list that threatens to disrupt his side's perfect start to the season.
articles.title: Man City 'in trouble' with injuries - Guardiola

articles.description: Jenni Hermoso says the decision to call-up players who are boycotting the national team is proof "nothing has changed" at the Spanish FA.
articles.title: Spain squad shows 'nothing has changed' - Hermoso

articles.description: Newcastle mark their return to the Champions League after a 20-year absence with a creditable draw at AC Milan.
articles.title: Newcastle draw at Milan on Champions League return

articles.description: Celtic's quest for a rare Champions League away victory goes on after having two men sent off in a second-half implosion to hand top seeds Feyenoord an opening group win.
articles.title: Nine-man Celtic lose to Feyenoord in chaotic opener

articles.description: European champions Manchester City come from behind to beat Red Star Belgrade in the opening game of their Champions League defence.
articles.title: Alvarez stars as Man City come back to beat Red Star

articles.description: Goalkeeper Mary Earps has won the England Women's Player of the Year award.
articles.title: Earps wins England Player of the Year award

articles.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola appears to laugh at the suggestion Manchester United are Premier League title rivals.
articles.title: Guardiola laughs when Man Utd suggested as title rivals

articles.description: England captain Leah Williamson tells the United Nations her football career has been a constant "battle" against gender inequality.
articles.title: My whole career has been a series of battles - Williamson

articles.description: Mikel Arteta urges his Arsenal players to "make the most of it" when the Gunners return to the Champions League stage after a six-year absence.
articles.title: Arsenal urged to make most of Champions League chance

articles.description: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag says he has "never started his best XI" as his injury-hit side prepare to face Bayern Munich in the Champions League.
articles.title: Ten Hag 'has never started best Man Utd XI'
